OOC: Remember, everyone, if I'm ever absent, it's because I get too drawn i=
nto WWF No mercy on the N64. Much similar to KSLawdogg's case, except the N=
64 always get's the better wrestling games. No offense to the Playstation, =
though, because they always get the better RPG's by a landslide...

BIC: Li=
ke-Like: Oh. Like-Like cannot fly, master. That okay?

Like-Like goes to th=
e coordinates that he was supposed to go to...
  ----- Original Message ---=
-- 
  From: dachande 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, Februa=
ry 20, 2001 10:49 AM
  Subject: Re: Alliance Proposal


  ::Magmatron::
   =

      "Like-Like," He said. "Can you fly? If so goody-goody, go to these c=
ordinates if you can. If not then go to these cordinates."
    ----- Origin=
al Message ----- 
    From: Soulstice Omega 
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com=
 
    Sent: Tuesday, February 20, 2001 1:54 AM
    Subject: Re: Alliance Pr=
oposal


    Like-Like was still sitting in one spot, sleeping, and droolin=
g. He was woken up by Magmatron's comm link call. He howls in rage, but the=
n thinks about what M<agmatron may need and replies.

    Like-Like: Where =
is Master at? Like-Like will help...

      ----- Original Message ----- 
 =
     From: dachande 
      To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Monday, =
February 19, 2001 11:29 PM
      Subject: Re: Alliance Proposal


      ::M=
agmatron::
       
          "Zardus, you have my full attention," He said.=
 "What do you want us to do? [To the ship and all Destrons] We are attackin=
g Hell Beast."
       
      ::Destrons::
       
          They all went t=
o the gun room and got some powerful weapons. Dachande loaded up and went t=
o the front. Battera did the same. The Nightmares did and got ready for ful=
l on combat. Praetorian got ready, as well as Jynx.
       
      ::Vukodla=
k::
       
          His time of awakening was coming close. He would dest=
roy what ever was left of the Autobots and the Decepticons.
          
    =
    ----- Original Message ----- 
        From: Yanshosh@... 
        T=
o: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
        Sent: Monday, February 19, 2001 10:55 PM=

        Subject: Re: Alliance Proposal


        ::Killfest/Zardus/FZ/Bloo=
dystrike::

        Killfest enters the conference room in time to hear Dri=
llBit and 
        Darkfate talking about the Alliance's proposal. He nods.=


        "Yes, I would enjoy a chance at battle against Hell Beast," he sa=
ys, 
        waiting for Zardus to reply to DarkFate.
        ~~~~~~~~~~~~~=
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
        Zardus taps a few buttons, making the channe=
l that he and Darkfate 
        were on secure.

        "My scanners detec=
t only two of his Predacons in your area," he says 
        to Darkfate, "I=
 have a potential mutiny in my base, so I don't know 
        if I can send=
 troops."

        He frowns, noticing something on the scanner reports of =
the CF. 
        Unitron's signature was there, but Unitron was also in the=
 base..

        "I have to go for a few moments," he says to Darkfate, "Th=
ere's 
        something I need to take care of."

        He closes the ch=
annel and turns to FZ.

        "Go to the CF and oversee that everything i=
s going fine. There's 
        something up."

        FZ nods, turning aro=
und and walking out of the bridge. He exits the 
        Iron Fist and blas=
ts off, heading toward the CF at top speed.

        Zardus turns back in h=
is chair, remembering something. The Destrons! 
        They were allies of=
 the Alliance as well..

        "Zardus to Magmatron," he says into his co=
mm, opening a channel to 
        Magmatron, "My troops are currently attac=
king Hell Beast's base. If 
        you could aid us there, or perhaps atta=
ck his troops at the 
        Cybertronian Fire, it would be greatly apprec=
iated and repaid. I 
        await your answer."

        He closes the cha=
nnel, sending a transmission to Darkfate again. "I'm 
        sending a bot=
 to help you out. That's all I can muster at the moment 
        though."

=
        He taps a few buttons, sending Bloodystrike an order.
        ~~~~~=
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
        Bloodystrike sighs, changing course ha=
lf-way to the Alliance base and 
        heading for the Black Fortress ins=
tead.




        --- In nbwrpg@y..., KSLawdogg@c... wrote:
        > (Ther=
e will be mass delays for any posting today from me, for two 
        reaso=
ns.  
        > My brother has a friend over and they plan on the computers=
 a lot, 
        and I'm 
        > playing Smackdown! 2 quite a bit on the=
 ol' playstation)
        > 
        > Vehement/Shockwave/Reflector/Sun Cru=
sher/Unicron/The Protectobots:
        > 
        > 
        > 
        > 
=
        > Vehement was lying on the ground, but kept his blood red optics 
=
        looking at 
        > the sun as the solar technology in them absor=
bed great amounts of 
        energy, his 
        > overall power level ba=
ck up to 65% again.  
        > 
        > He stood, firing off a wide blas=
t of optic energy, intercepting 
        three charges 
        > heading f=
or Sun Crusher.  Twenty five blasts struck Vehement's 
        armor, not 
=
        > penetrating it or even coming close to it.
        > 
        > T=
he ginormous robot stretched an arm with a sick smile.  His left 
        a=
rm 
        > transformed into a wide cannon as a eight foot long broadswor=
d 
        appeared in 
        > his right hand.
        > 
        > Rais=
ing the cannon of an arm, he launching two energy-signature 
        seekin=
g 
        > missiles at Iron Raptor's abdomen.
        > 
        > Moving=
 the point of the broadsword to point at Condor, a fire ball 
        errup=
ting 
        > from it at the enemy's chest.
        > 
        > ---
    =
    > 
        > Reflector felt a surge of power, that told him Unicron was=
 
        siphoning more 
        > power to him.  Getting up and ignoring =
the pain as twenty-three 
        shots dug 
        > into his body, he ra=
ised an arm, launching two missile at IRIS from 
        his wrist 
       =
 > cannon.
        > 
        > ---
        > 
        > Sun Crusher rolled=
 to the left, the explosions from the charge 
        sending him 
        =
> flipping through the air, slamming painfully to his legs, almost 
       =
 causing him 
        > to crash to the ground.  "That's it, heathens," he =
said, spitting 
        mech-fluid 
        > into the burnt grass before h=
im, "you want to die painfully, be my 
        guest."
        > 
        >=
 With that, his shaped twisted into the form of a tank, Sun Crusher 
      =
  the hover 
        > tank bringing a long barrel to point at the CF, laun=
ching three 
        explosive 
        > shells from the bowels of the tan=
k.
        > 
        > ---
        > 
        > Unicron, still disguised a=
s Unitron, activated a comm. link to all 
        Alliance 
        > membe=
rs at the scene of the Cybertronian Fire.  
        > 
        > "All Allia=
nce warriors, this is Unitron," his voice sounding 
        exactly like 
 =
       > Unitron's, his appearance the same as well, "I received orders fro=
m 
        Zardus, 
        > leave everyone alone and focus solely on crip=
pling the Cybertronian 
        Fire 
        > beyond repair.  Then make a=
 full retreat."
        > 
        > =3D=3D=3D
        > 
        > Shockwa=
ve was flying at his top speed for atmospheric conditions in 
        his s=
pace 
        > fighter mode, arming all his weapons.  The cause would not =
fall.
        > 
        > =3D=3D=3D
        > 
        > Hot Spot looked a=
t two CR chambers, noticing First Aid and Blades 
        were still 
     =
   > badly damaged.  He then looked over to Groove and Streetwise.
        =
> 
        > "Blades is closer to being repaired.  I will stay here and hav=
e him 
        go out to 
        > help you while you attack the enemies o=
utside.
        > 
        > Groove and Streetwise nodded, runinng as fast =
as they could for 
        their nearest 
        > exit out of the ship th=
at wasn't a large hole in the ship.
